revision.text:
{{Bible translation infobox | image = [[File:World English Bible Cover.jpg|250px|Public Domain Cover]] | Name = World English Bible | Caption = Public Domain Cover | translation_title=World English Bible | full_name=World English Bible | abbreviation=WEB | wikisource=Bible (World English) | complete_bible_published=2000 | derived_from = The [[American Standard Version]] 1901 | textual_basis = '''NT:''' [[Byzantine text-type|Byzantine Majority Text by Robinson and Pierpont]] 1991. '''OT:''' [[Biblia Hebraica Stuttgartensia]] (with some [[Septuagint]] and [[Dead Sea Scrolls]] influence). | online_address=http://www.ebible.org/ | translation_type=[[Dynamic and formal equivalence|Formal equivalence]] | author_info=Michael Paul Johnson (''Editor in Chief'') | publisher=Rainbow Missions | copyright=Public domain (copyright waived) | genesis_1:1-3=In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. Now the earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep. God's Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters. God said, "Let there be light," and there was light. | john_3:16=For God so loved the world, that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life. }} {{BibleHistory}}
The '''World English Bible''' (also known as the '''WEB''') is a free updated revision of the [[American Standard Version]] (1901). It is one of the few [[public domain]], present-day English translations of the entire [[Bible]], and it is freely distributed to the public using electronic formats. The Bible was created by volunteers using the ASV as the base text as part of the ebible.org project through Rainbow Missions, Inc., a Colorado nonprofit corporation.<ref>[http://stason.org/TULARC/education-books/bible-world-english/index.html#.URfUivKt90E Michael Paul Johnson - World English Bible Translation FAQ]</ref>
==Features== The World English Bible claims to be one of the few English-language Bibles custom translated to be understood by most English-speakers worldwide, eliminating the need for [[data processing|data-processing]] based or [[computer operating system]]-specific internationalizations. Work on the World English Bible began in 1997 and it was first known as the ''American Standard Version 1997''.
The World English Bible project was started in order to produce a modern English Bible version that is not copyrighted, does not use archaic English (such as the [[KJV]]), and is not translated into [[Basic English]] (such as the ''[[Bible In Basic English]]''). The World English Bible follows the American Standard Version's decision to [[transliteration|transliterate]] the [[Tetragrammaton]], but uses "[[Yahweh]]" instead of "[[Jehovah]]" throughout the Old Testament. The British and Messianic editions as well as the Apocryphal books and New Testament use the traditional forms (e.g., the LORD).
The translation also includes the following [[Biblical apocrypha|Apocryphal]] books (in the following order): # [[Book of Tobit|Tobit]] # [[Judith]] # [[Book of Esther#Additions to Esther|Additions to Esther]] (additions found in the [[LXX]] namely Esther 10:4 – 16:24) # [[Wisdom]] (also known as the Wisdom of Solomon) # [[Ecclesiasticus]] (or Sirach) # [[Book of Baruch|Baruch]] # [[Epistle of Jeremy]] (or the Letter of Jeremy) # [[The Prayer of Azariah and Song of the Three Holy Children|Prayer of Azarias]] (Daniel 3:24–97 in the LXX & [[Vulgate]]) # [[Susanna (Book of Daniel)|Susanna]] (Daniel 13 in the LXX & Vulgate) # [[Bel and the Dragon]] (Daniel 14 in the LXX & Vulgate) # [[I Maccabees]] # [[II Maccabees]] # [[1 Esdras]] # [[Prayer of Manasses]] # [[Psalm 151]] # [[III Maccabees]] # [[IV Maccabees]] # [[2 Esdras]]
==Translation philosophy== The work is based on the 1901 ''[[American Standard Version]]'' English translation, the Greek ''[[Byzantine text-type|Majority Text]]'', and the Hebrew ''[[Biblia Hebraica Stuttgartensia]]'' with some minor adjustments made because of alternate readings found in the [[Dead Sea Scrolls]] and the [[Septuagint]]. These alternate readings are usually ignored or restricted to the footnotes. The translation process included seven passes of editing and proofreading for each book. An initial automated pass updated approximately 1,000 archaic words, phrases and grammatical constructs. The first manual pass added quotation marks (the ASV had none) and other punctuation and compared the translation to the Greek and Hebrew texts in areas where significant textual variants or meanings were unclear.
==Critical reception== Evangelical site GotQuestions.org praised the WEB for being "a modern, free, and public domain English translation of the Bible" while also criticising the translation's sentence structure as "not always in the most natural-sounding and free-flowing English". The site suggests the lack of physical print copies has made the translation difficult for widespread adoption by Christian communities.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.gotquestions.org/World-English-Bible-WEB.html|title=What is the World English Bible (WEB)?|author=Got Questions?|accessdate=8 February 2018}}</ref>
The Provident Planning web site uses the World English Bible because it is free of copyright restrictions and because the author considers it to be a good translation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.providentplan.com/1023/why-i-use-the-world-english-bible-web-version/|title=Why I use the World English Bible (WEB) Version|author=Corey|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref>
The Bible Megasite review of the World English Bible says it is a good revision of the American Standard Version of 1901 (ASV) into modern English, which also corrects some textual issues with the ASV.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://biblemegasite.com/why-web.html|title=David's Review of the World English Bible|author=David|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref>
The World English Bible is widely published in digital formats by a variety of publishers.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://WorldEnglish.Bible|title=World English Bible|author=Michael Paul Johnson|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.olivetree.com/store/product.php?productid=42749|author=Olive Tree Bible Software|title=World English Bible (WEB), Ecumenical|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/world-english-bible-web-audio-holy-scriptures/id669896123?mt=8|title=World English Bible WEB Audio Holy Scriptures|author=Li Liangpu|accessdate=31 October 2018}}</ref>
==See also== *[[American Standard Version]] *[[New American Standard Bible]] *[[Open English Bible]] *[[Shem Qadosh Version]]
